zemeckis

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • zemeckis.Scheduler

  • public final class Scheduler
extends Object
    The scheduler is responsible for scheduling and executing tasks asynchronously. The scheduler provides an "abstract asynchronous boundary" to stream operators.

    The scheduler has an internal clock that represents time as a monotonically increasing int value. The value may or may not have a direct relationship to wall-clock time and the unit of the value is defined by the implementation. Tasks can be scheduled to be invoked after a delay or repeatedly with a fixed period.

    The scheduler assigns tasks to different VirtualProcessorUnit (VPU) instances that run at different phases in the browser lifecycle. Tasks can be scheduled on the:

    • "Macro" task VPU. The normal phase where event callbacks, timer timeouts, message channel handlers etc. are invoked.
    • "Micro" task VPU. Invoked immediately after the current "Macro" or "Micro" task.
    • "animationFrame" VPU. Invoked prior to the next browser render.
    • "afterFrame" VPU. Invoked after the next browser render.
    • "onIdle" VPU. Invoked when the browser is idle.

      • schedule

        @Nonnull public static Cancelable schedule(@Nonnull Runnable task,
                                           int delay)
        Schedules the execution of the given task after a specified delay.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        delay - the delay before the task should execute. Must be a value greater than 0.
        Returns:
        the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

                                                      int period)
        Schedules the periodic execution of the given task with specified period.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute.
        period - the period after execution when the task should be re-executed. Must be a value greater than 0.
        Returns:
        the Cancelable instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.

      • macroTask

        public static void macroTask(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Queue the task to execute in the next "macro" task. This is the default VPU in the browser and indicates tasks that are scheduled via a call to setTimeout(callback,0).
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • becomeMacroTask

        public static void becomeMacroTask(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Run specified task now by queuing on MacroTask VPU and activating VPU. This is invoked when the browser has triggered a macro task as a result of a callback of some kind. The specified task is added to the start of the macroTask queue but any tasks present on the queue will be invoked after the specified task.
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • microTask

        public static void microTask(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Queue the task to execute in the next "micro" task. The "micro" tasks are those that the browser executes after the current "macro" or "micro" task. This VPU schedules an activation via a call to Promise.resolve().then( v -> callback() ).
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • microTaskVpu

        @Nonnull public static VirtualProcessorUnit microTaskVpu()
        Return the "micro" task VPU.
        Returns:
        the "micro" task VPU.
        See Also:
        microTask(Runnable)

      • animationFrame

        public static void animationFrame(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Queue the task to execute in the next "animationFrame". The "animationFrame" occurs prior to the next render frame. This VPU schedules an activation via a call to requestAnimationFrame( callback ).
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • animationFrameVpu

        @Nonnull public static VirtualProcessorUnit animationFrameVpu()
        Return the "animationFrame" VPU.
        Returns:
        the "animationFrame" VPU.
        See Also:
        microTask(Runnable)

      • afterFrame

        public static void afterFrame(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Queue the task to execute after the next browser render. The "afterFrame" tasks are invoked after the next frames render by responding to a message on a MessageChannel that is sent in requestAnimationFrame().
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • afterFrameVpu

        @Nonnull public static VirtualProcessorUnit afterFrameVpu()
        Return the "afterFrame" VPU.
        Returns:
        the "afterFrame" VPU.
        See Also:
        microTask(Runnable)

      • onIdle

        public static void onIdle(@Nonnull Runnable task)
        Queue the task to execute when the browser is idle. The browser activates the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit when idle and will pass the duration for which the VPU may run. The VPU will execute tasks as long as there is tasks queued and the deadline has not been reached after which the VPU will return control to the browser. Unlike other VPUs, when the onIdle VirtualProcessorUnit completes the activation, there may still be tasks in the queue and if there is the VPU will re-schedule itself for another activation. This VPU schedules an activation via a call to requestIdleCallback( callback ).
        Parameters:
        task - the task.

      • onIdleVpu

        @Nonnull public static VirtualProcessorUnit onIdleVpu()
        Return the "onIdle" VPU.
        Returns:
        the "onIdle" VPU.
        See Also:
        microTask(Runnable)
